instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01326: What is 820-01326? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP2V5_NAND_SSD0: What is PP2V5_NAND_SSD0? PP2V5_NAND_SSD0 This is a power rail that powers the NAND on Macbooks where the solid state drive is soldered directly to the board. .
definitions.PP2V5_NAND_SSD1: What is PP2V5_NAND_SSD1? PP2V5_NAND_SSD1 is a power rail that powers the soldered on SSDs.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01326</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-05 not coming up
threads.message:
The board is drawing 20v 
All voltages are present 
Except <SIGNAL>PP2V5_NAND_SSD1</SIGNAL> that reads 3.6v instead of 2.5
<SIGNAL>PP2V5_NAND_SSD0</SIGNAL> is 2.5v.
<SIGNAL>PP2V5_NAND_SSD1</SIGNAL> is 3.6v.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01326</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-05 not coming up
threads.message:
Any history, liquid signs?
Compare diode mode readings between SSD0/1 areas.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01326</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-05 not coming up
threads.message:
No history or any liquid sign
<SIGNAL>PP2V5_NAND_SSD0</SIGNAL>=0.374
<SIGNAL>PP2V5_NAND_SSD1</SIGNAL>=0.375

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01326</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-05 not coming up
threads.message:
Check <RESISTOR>R9580</RESISTOR>/1/3.
Compare diode mode readings around <CHIP>U9080</CHIP>/580.
